text: Bottle shared at THT. Slight hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, coriander, cardboard, toffee, dried herbs and some grass. Medium sweet and under medium bitter. Medium bodied.
Sampled from bottle at THT June at kwartje. Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, coriander and cloves. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur dorée, mousse moyenne de tenue assez faible. Des arômes d amandes, du fruité, de l alcool (cognac). Carbonnation moyenne. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.
Persoonlijke favoriet. Heerlijk kruidig bier, lichtzoet met vanille. Helaas niet altijd goed verkrijgbaar.

Well carbonated and well balanced. Not very dry, not very sweet. In the middle range, aning triples. Not heavy, as for example Maredsous 10, and not as light as for example Karmeliet. Very nice bit not one of the very best.
Gedronken met Peter, smaakt kruidig, richting tre fontane, komt door koriader waarschijnlijk, prima biertje wel, lichtzoet, vanille, voldoende bitter, mondgevoel prima
33cl bottle from bierhandel. Hazy dark gold. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body. Dry body. Medium carbonation. Aroma and flavour is honey, hops, fruit, spices, leaves.
Bottle from Geers. Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Sweet nose of banana, red fruit, sweet malts. Bitter finish. Well balanced. Very nice tripel.

Bottle @ home. Looks amber and a bit cloudy with a small white head. Smells sweet and herby with a small hint of malts. Taste starts off with sweetness from the cognac, caramel and red fruit to be followed by malts and overall just a slight but very pleasant bitterness and hint of sour. Overall, a very nice beer that I would happily recommend.

Spices, citrus, some banana and maltiness in nose. Pours golden with white frothy head. Taste is medium dry with spices, citrus and herbs. Medium bitter finish, lively carbonation. Overall good, cant say how it has 10% ABV, silent killer.

Golden with frothy white head. Nose is a little shy but still with some malts and fresh citrus to accompany loads of yeast. Taste is very carbonated and also some herbal or citric tones but very little roundness. Palate also dominated by yeast and rather short.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, orange, grain and spices.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Great sweet flavour thanks to the loads of Belgian yeast. There are only some spices in the finish to create a balance. Shamefully it is very filtered, guess that could have fixed its flaws.

W aromacie to, co ma być, czyli oddrożdżowe przyprawy, zboże, lekkie muśnięcie owocowe, bardzo to lubię. W smaku smukły, wytrawny, wyraźnie przyprawowy, owocowych nutek mniej. Nieco alkoholu. Bardzo pijalne, świetnie skrojony, choć w moje preferencje trafia połowicznie. Wolę bardziej cieliste, gładsze, zaokrąglone triple.

At beer festival in Turnhout with Yves and Tim hazy golden blond colored body with a white head and a spicy fruity yeast hops aroma a spicy sweet fruity hop alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish
Shared with wim and Tim at bierfestival molen Oost. Herby hopped aroma. Medium sparkling palate. Finish is hopped bitter sweet.

Mooi helder goudblond bier met volle witte schuimkraag die langzaam wegebt. Aroma en smaken van koriander, beetje citrus, brood, heel licht banaan. Eindelijk een tripel die niet doorslaat in de koriander en ruimte laat voor andere smaken. Goed in balans. Warme, licht bittere, afdronk. Prima alweer van het nest.

F: average, snow-white, not long lasting.
C: pale gold, hazy.
A: malt, orange peels, banana, candy, yeasty, peach, hint of apple, spicy.
T: malt, banana, light orange peels, peppery combined with honey, candy, grassy, dusty, light spicy, medium to full body, medium carbonation, the taste is very good balanced and for such 10% quite easy drinkable, enjoyed and worth to try, 0,33l bottle from Prik & Tik ABC Drinks in Leuven.
De geur is lekker fruitig. De kleur lichtblond. De smaak is vol, met een licht fruitige toets.

13/XII/16 - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ home - BB: XII/2017 (2016-1469) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, big irregular creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, overripe pineapple, some banana, rum, oxidized stuff, alcohol, fusels, yeast, calvados. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sweet, overripe fruits, banana, calvados, alcohol, bit yeasty, more alcohol. Aftertaste: little bitter, spicy touch, some ripe apples and pears, banana peel, bit oxidized.

Purs clear blonde, good white head. Smell is mellow maltyness, mild hoppyness. Not as crispy, not as fresh as the regular version. Taste is sharp, higher carbo than expected ( on the virge of to high ) the hoppyness I truly like in the basebeer, shines way less here I dont really get a lot of the previously ( ratings ) aspects, unfortunately. perhaps its me, or is there bottle variation ? The beer isnt boozy, and theres for sure nothing wrong with it. yet, I prefer the soft, balanced, mild creamy hoppy taste from the regular over this

Bottle: Hazy sparkling yellow colour, with a nice head. Aroma is dominted of belgian yeastynes, frech hopy, citrus and flowers. Flavor had a almost the same, frech , dominas of belgian yeastynes, citrus, flowers. Some alcohol, and a nice sweet maltynes. Medium to full body, medium long fruity finish!
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Doft av citrus och jäst. Lätt kemisk smak av jäst och citrus.

Draft glass @ Gollem. Lightly hazy orange, creamy white going to off-white head. Nose is sweet grain soup, massively sweet banana, crazily sweet, excessively, unpleasant Belgian esters mixed with banana bread. Apparently they dry-hopped this one with Cascade, totally not getting that. Taste is banana both puree & green banana, excessively yeast, unpleasant stale slab of yeast, cheap cornflakes, excessively yeast, unpleasant grain, poor esters, green leaves & excess of sugar. Body is cheap cornflakes, sugar, grain. Not a fan, bad excessively overly heavy, overly ester heavy tripel. Cognac BA version was stupidly better, this needed to be fixed.
Color oro carico, con riflessi arancio. Triple molto solida con sentori di miele, banana e spezie. Carbonazione abbastanza consistente, ma mai fastidiosa. Eccellente.

New extra version of Schuppenboer, thanks Jan for sharing. Very thick and frothy, egg-white head over a clear and warm old gold coloured beer with pale orangey hue and very fierce sparkling. Aroma immediately betrays the extra dosis of coriander (as in dry coriander seed), aligned with hints of ginger, bakers yeast, sweet potato, dried banana, gin, radish, nutmeg, pineapple, turnip, mustard seed, pear, unripe plum and some iron. Cleanish fruity onset, crisp with sweetish hints of peach, banana and pineapple along with sourish gooseberry, fizzy carbo but not really overcarbonated for this style, smooth and somewhat creamy mouthfeel, nice caramelly and honeyish malt sweetness with a drier grainy edge, lots of soapy coriander in the finish as expected, some bready yeastiness in the end as well as a spicy hop bitter touch and a glow of warming, gin-like alcohol. Nice spicy tripel, fairly clean and well-balanced. I dont usually like this much coriander, but I have to admit that if you are going to apply it to a tripel anyway in reinforcing an old Belgian cliché, this is a perfectly acceptable way to do it. Technically at a relatively high standard too, like most of Nests beers.
Color oro carico con riflessi ambra e densa schiuma molto persistente. Ottima triple, anche se un po dolce.
Troebel donkergeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is krachtig, licht zoet en kruidig, toffee en honing.
